title: Creamy Cottage Cheese Scrambled Eggs Recipe
description: These fluffy cottage cheese scrambled eggs are cooked in butter to make a delicious low-carb breakfast for two in just 10 minutes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Eggs Scrambled Creamy Cottage Cheese Scrambled Eggs 4.7 (184) 152 Reviews 24 Photos These scrambled eggs with cottage cheese are creamy, fluffy, and make a delicious change from regular scrambled eggs. Perfect with a slice of tomato and turkey bacon for a delicious and fast low-carb breakfast. Submitted by Kitchen Kitty Updated on March 21, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 24 24 24 24 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 tablespoon butter 4 large eggs, beaten ¼ cup cottage cheese 1 teaspoon chopped fresh chives, or to taste (Optional) ground black pepper to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Pour beaten eggs into the skillet; let cook undisturbed until the bottom of the eggs begins to firm, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir cottage cheese and chives into eggs and season with black pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook and stir until eggs are nearly set, 3 to 4 minutes more. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 893 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 224 Calories 17g Fat 2g Carbs 16g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 224 % Daily Value * Total Fat 17g 22% Saturated Fat 8g 38% Cholesterol 392mg 131% Sodium 295mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 2g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 0% Total Sugars 1g Protein 16g 32% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 74mg 6% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 167mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Cottage Cheese Scrambled Eggs 01 of 24 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 24 Photo by  TxCin2 01/21/2025 It tastes just like scrambled eggs. I couldn't taste cottage cheese but it did add some volume. The curds melted somewhat and some of them got stringy, but most stayed in little curd form, so it looks like egg white. If you didn't tell people there was cottage cheese in this, I don't think they would know. I'm not sure I am a fan of the chives in this, but I am not a fan of onions anyway. They are okay, but I'd rather not have that odd oniony taste. I might fix this again as it was okay, but I am not an egg fan and this was very eggy in flavor and texture. Yes, it is scrambled eggs, but in an attempt to eat healthier, eggs are an integral part of a low fat, low carb, high protein nutrition plan, and I'm trying all the ways to make eggs to see what I enjoy. Sometimes with the additions they lose some of that eggy flavor and texture, however, this was not one of those egg masking dishes. It was fine, and if you like eggs, then you'll probably enjoy this easy dish. I'd eat it again, but it's not one of my first options for egg. 03 of 24 Photo by  JollyPho3428 06/20/2024 Easy to follow 04 of 24 Photo by  France C 02/27/2024 Easy to follow I really enjoyed these eggs. Not sure why I had never tried adding cottage cheese before, but I loved the subtle creaminess it added to the eggs. It wasn't obvious the cheese was in there, but you could definitely see the eggs were more creamy. This recipe needs salt to bring out the flavors, but otherwise I like it as is. I'll be making these again. 05 of 24 Photo by  lutzflcat 02/16/2024 Needs more flavor They definitely are creamy, and the texture is a bit different, not good or bad, just different. I really could taste very little difference with the addition of the cottage cheese. They turned out OK, but doubtful I’ll bother adding cottage cheese in the future. 06 of 24 Photo by  BraveBeer9517 12/18/2023 I added spinach, green peppers and tomatoes. Keto diet recommends a lot of greasy meat that isn’t that great for you. Plus, people post keto recipes and rarely add veggies. I guess that’s why keto is so popular. Thanks for the yummy recipe! 07 of 24 Photo by  RosyFarro6199 05/14/2023 This was delicious and was perfect for a mother's day breakfast 🍳♥️ But it took longer than expected to cook. Takes more than 6 minutes to cook like it says. 08 of 24 Photo by  Wynter Lester 07/18/2021 09 of 24 Photo by  Sahil Chopra 09/16/2020 10 of 24 Photo by  Sahil Chopra 09/16/2020 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Cottage Cheese Breakfast Bowl 3 Ratings Sriracha Scrambled Eggs 26 Ratings Scrambled Eggs with Chorizo 32 Ratings Black Bean Breakfast Bowl 134 Ratings Green Chile Microwave Scrambled Eggs 1 Rating Ham and Cheese Chop Chop 19 Ratings Zucchini with Egg 17 Ratings Green Chile Tortilla Scramble 11 Ratings Easy Fluffy Scrambled Eggs 65 Ratings Scrambled Eggs with Wild Puffball Mushrooms 2 Ratings Fresh Tomato Parmesan Scramble 27 Ratings Microwave Longaniza con Huevos Scrambled Peanut Butter Eggs 9 Ratings Sous Vide Egg Bites 10 Ratings Spanish Chorizo and Tomato Scrambled Eggs 17 Ratings Indian-Style Scrambled Eggs 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
